column9: ['The Jaskol Group is a highly specialized boutique strategic and succession planning firm, that has been providing solutions for business owners for the past 30 years. There is a team of business, wellness, and marketing experts who have been shaping profitable solutions for healthcare practitioners and fitness professionals for almost 20 years. Developed and established licensing system to help to set up and implement staff-operated medical fitness programs with self-supported marketing programs in  businesses across country. Launched licensing system in February 2012 through a series of webinar presentations. Coached licensee's through entire process from training on systems, to hiring staff, to marketing, Established three new licensed locations in USA.", "Maresca Enterprises is the holding company for Medford Sports Club which is a multi-purpose family fitness center. The club is a 40,000 square foot facility which has over 3000 members including a nationally ranked swimming team and adjoining fitness related programs. Oversaw all key areas including all financial affairs, staff leadership, facilities management, marketing and efficiency of each department. Created children's fitness center which was recognized as the only one of its kind in the Delaware valley being featured on Fox News. Created the only PGA endorsed Golf Fitness center of its kind in New Jersey. Implemented various growth strategies to exponentially increase revenue from 1,100,000 to 1,800,000 within a 4 year period, for example personal training from 3,000 per month to 30,000 per month. Designed and implemented a prescription based wellness program with local physicians to improve the well-being of the de-conditioned patients. Restructured  member service to increase customer retention from 35% to 71%. Established retail division and concession services. Sales reached 45,000 annually.", "Liberty State is a full service financial firm with four divisions offering services related to customers' needs that pertained to financial planning, lending, investments, and banking. Integral part in the formation of the company, raising the initial capital and ~~~~~~~~~operations. Vote on policies and procedures for operations as well as overall strategic plan for company. As a board member attend all meetings.", "As part of one of the Philadelphia's largest privately owned full service financial services company, the business planning division was created to offer specialized planning for high net worth private business owners. Developed and created the infrastructure and systems for the division. Hired and developed staff. Created the marketing system for the new division. In the first year of operation implemented six in depth strategies for various clients resulting in $250,000 of first year revenue.", 'Fisher Investments, Inc. is a 30-year old private money management firm.  Having 12 billion in assets under management, the firm manages for institutions, endowments, and over 8,000 high net worth clients in the United States and Europe. Responsible for recruiting assets under management within the Mid-Atlantic region by meeting with and guiding high net worth prospects through all aspects of the sales process including qualifying, needs analysis, and providing enough value added advice for clients to feel comfortable enough to invest with the firm. Introduced over $141,000,000 in private client managed assets during tenure at the firm, which was enough to be in top quartiles in both assets under management and new relationships. Qualified for 4 separate production related bonuses awarded to superior producers.', 'As part of the largest bank corporation in the United States, managing $165 billion of assets, the private capital management group provides the critical link between banking and investing by complimenting conventional bank offerings with sophisticated investment products and services that help clients meet their lifetime financial goals. Understanding the key features and benefits of various trusts as well as other services and being able to effectively articulate these features and benefits to First Union Securities Brokers as well as local attorneys, accountants, and other professionals. Providing clients of the First Union Securities Brokers with sophisticated estate planning strategies as well as other services of the private capital management group ultimately resulting in $20 million in retained assets under management. Assembled and led a team of specialists to service each client with a tailored approach to maintain the ongoing relationship that dramatically increased customer satisfaction ultimately leading to increased business of 50% plus.', "First Business Advisors is a specialty division of First Union Bank that focuses on exit strategies and succession planning for closely held companies Primary client base has been family owned businesses with valuations between 10 million and 500 million. Prospect, evaluate, and develop new business from cold calls, referrals, and seminars leading to $2.5 million in new revenue in the last three years. Assist business owners in clarifying future direction of business by conducting extensive analysis relating to the options of continuity issues for family members and key employees or developing a timely exit strategy. Provided overall project leadership by working closely with client's existing advisor to facilitate the timely design and implementation of selected planning strategies. Completed over 45 succession and estate planning cases with combined assets totaling over 1 billion. Guide clients through their alternatives of a third party sale to a strategic/financial buyer and which of the possible suitors are most appropriate for their situations given current market conditions. Successfully developed and coordinated multiple sale assignments across a broad range of industries with cumulative value of over 200 million. Participated in multiple seminars and workshops for industry groups and family business centers, including Farleigh-Dickinson University, Loyola University of Chicago, The Direct Marketing Association, and The Beverage Industry."]

column9: ['Provide expertise in IT governance, collaboration services, and infrastructure development as well as high-level strategy and guidance to drive development and adoption of new collaboration services and methods. Direct IT operations of the Groupware Leadership Center (GLC) with a focus on optimizing support for centralized, coordinated, and consistent enterprise-wide messaging and collaboration technologies that cross locational and functional boundaries. Supervise and mentor a 43-person team dispersed across the US and aggressively manage a $16M annual budget.Key Achievements:* Provided oversight and direction for the FRS mobility strategy, which brought in a new, strategic mobile device management solution (AirWatch), and directed transition from BlackBerry to iPhone for all FRS mobile users* Directed large, year-long effort to implement enforced email classification capabilities on desktop and mobile email clients to better protect FRS information assets.* Sponsored and provided significant input on two major efforts to develop multi-year strategies for Unified Communications and Endpoint Services, consulting with industry analysts to ensure strategy aligned with vendor and industry direction.* Established an External Collaboration program that provided greater visibility and communication on all of the external collaboration initiatives underway to ensure they met business line needs.* Formed new External Collaboration Advisory Group (ECAG), with representation from multiple business lines to advise on business requirements and prioritization of external collaboration initiatives.* Formed and chaired a compliance and control advisory group, bringing together representatives from compliance-related disciplines (such as legal, information security, records management, and HR) for the first time to provide early guidance and consolidated feedback to service providers on IT initiatives.', 'Promoted to lead the Emerging Technologies division of the GLC, which evaluated and introduced new internal and external collaboration technologies to meet changing, cross-departmental business needs. Held full authority for entire project lifecycle - from initial concept through design to adoption - for large-scale, innovative collaboration tools. Collaborated with individuals across the organization, including C-level executives, to deliver a successful program.Key Achievements:* Led multi-year, $15M Connect & Share Program to adopt a Microsoft-based collaboration platform; delivered project on time and budget.- Improved user productivity and satisfaction by implementing core messaging and collaboration services such as Microsoft Outlook/Exchange, Microsoft Lync/Skype for Business, and Sitrion Social Sites.- Drove major migration from Lotus team sites to Microsoft SharePoint.* Introduced social business collaboration tools enterprise-wide and worked with key technical and business contacts to drive adoption by more than 50% of the user population in just 1 year.* Coordinated consolidation of mobile services into the GLC from the Federal Reserve Bank of NY.* Led effort to develop 3- to 5-year Collaboration Strategy, working in conjunction with industry analysts and successfully articulating to executives the vision for transforming collaboration capabilities.', "Functioned above title by fulfilling leadership positions in mission-critical projects and committees. Served as the Groupware Leadership Center's liaison to the Lotus Notes/Domino development community. Performed daily functions in support of the Lotus team, focusing primarily on collaboration tools. Served as a resource and facilitator for monthly developer meetings.Key Achievements:* Assumed primary support for the Lotus team collaboration tool (QuickPlace/Quickr) and drove adoption across business areas by developing an intuitive interface that enabled users to easily see the sites that they had access to.* Established a workgroup to set direction for wiki and blog tools in the Federal Reserve, which led to the selection and implementation of a standard wiki tool for the System.* Active participant representing the Lotus Notes/Domino community on the Web Developers Forum, a system-wide development steering committee. Assisted in organizing the group's annual meeting and creating development standards."]

column9: ['Project Description: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities and investment management services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and high-net-worth individuals. the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Hong Kong and other major financial centers around the world. We monitor the servers across the Goldman environment, We have more than 30000 databases in all the region including US, UK, ASIA and other parts of the world .Managing  the replication across all the regions which includes homogeneous and heterogeneous.Responsibilities:ã Working as a Platform Services manager and leading a Team of 30 highly skilled DBAs, Unix Admins, Storage Admins, Backups Admins and Windows Admins.ã Task allocation and performance evaluation of team members.ã Challenges others to develop as leaders while serving as a role model.ã Project scheduling, planned work scheduling and resource management.ã Update project status, present monthly reports to senior management thru calls and Sharepoint updates.ã Meet with client teams and gather requirements, conduct regular team meetings and track project progress.ã Interview candidates and hire resources.ã Part of Weekend On calls Manager Rotation to handle all Operational escalations.ã Manager of Summer Interns for DB server decommission Automation.ã Suggests areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions.ã Provide Production Support for Sybase ASE/ Sybase Replication/ Sybase IQ/ UDB-DB2/ DB2 SQL Replication/ Paraccel/ Mongodb / Hadoop/ Postgres/ MS-SQL server/ Oracle database server globally.ã Installation, configuration, maintenance and implementation of Sybase ASE, Sybase Replication, Sybase IQ, UDB-DB2, Hadoop servers on Linux operating systems.ã Creation/building of Sybase ASE/ IQ/ Replication/ UDB-DB2 servers.ã Upgradation/Migration of Sybase ASE/ Sybase IQ/ Sybase Replication/ UDB-DB2/ Mongodb servers.ã Patching of Sybase ASE/ Replication/ IQ/ UDB-DB2 servers to Standard version. column9: ['Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) - As a global lead of NSFR, responsible for updating status of the incremental data elements data sourcing and report automation by each product for all global regions (Americas, Europe, Asia Pacific) to the executive steering committee. Translated the NSFR regulation to the operational and implementable functions within the firm\'s strategic platform partnering with Liquidity Policy & Regulatory Matters and Liquidity Risk Oversight groups. Designed the tactical solution by automating 46% of total notional balances from the balance sheet leveraging existing transactional data and adjustment functionality to the businesses for the remaining products to complete NSFR. Analyzed and designed the feeds for standardized Risk Weight Assets (RWA), Secured Financing Fin41 Netting and Derivatives Fin39 Netting while leading the design sessions to consume Fin41 netting entries into Sources & Uses allocation engine. Laid out program level milestones to work across the firm to achieve automated NSFR Operating model by earnings timeframe (BD-10) at the quarter end.Product Lead (Securities, Securities Financing) - Led the securities\' effective maturity solution between Secured Lending and Secured Funding transactions within firm\'s allocation of Source & Uses for FRB 5G FR2052a Reporting and US LCR Reporting. Leading the resolution of data quality issues identified by Fed in Mandatory Required Action (MRA) to remediate security pricing issue, missing cash or collateral leg, forward settling tri-party deals issues, inter-company asymmetry, missing collateral class information with upstream source systems and missing link of inter-company secured financing transaction to 3rd party source within Sources & Uses allocation engine by MRA timeframe. Implemented the framework and operating model to expand the definition of "Treasury Control" under the US LCR and jurisdictional LCRs to include broader pool of eligible HQLA securities, primarily in Investment Bank for which the central treasury function is able to demonstrate control of the securities.FR 2052a (5G) Reporting and 5G based LCR - Partnered with Liquidity Policy & Regulatory Matters group for Fed Mandatory Required Action (MRA) resolution of 21 items out of total 97. The items include Securities, Secured Financing upstream issues related to pricing & inter-company asymmetry, inconsistent balance sheet classification, missing leg causing Z-1 asset categorization, structured notes reporting nuance for firmwide vs legal entity reporting and Foreign HQLA calculation in FR 2052a reporting (5G). Led the project of building 5G based LCR, maturity mismatch add-on calculation, add-on drivers and other Tableau based analytics capabilities including end to end operating model implementation of convergence of firm\'s LCR from 5G as per the FRB 5G instructions mapping appendix.US Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR)  - Responsible for understanding Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR) reporting regulation by US FRB and translate to operational and implementable functions within the firm\'s strategic Liquidity Risk Infrastructure. Coordinated the liquidity stress governance approved implementation with all business treasuries across all regions, Liquidity Risk Oversight, Liquidity Policy & Regulatory Matters and Corporate Treasury Middle Office.G-SIB Short Term Wholesale Funding: Developed the business process to calculate Short Term Wholesale Funding Score as part of FR Y 15 Regulatory framework  for Globally Systematic Important Bank (G-SIB) J.P.Morgan Chase & Co. Partnered with Liquidity Policy & Regulatory Matters in developing mapping of Short Term Wholesale Funding score using daily 5G FRB submission, building process to calculate the 12 month daily trailing average score by each business, developed analytics capabilities  and setting up operating model for LOB treasurers to attest the score on monthly basis.Trading assets deep-dive: Led the work-group to identify gaps in trades and position level trading assets (securities, loans and other assets) from Liquidity Risk Infrastructure with general ledger by comparing FR Y 15 submission data. The analysis helped Middle Office close the Fed mandated Audit questions.', "LCR Deposits By Business - Managed the analytics project to produce the firm's Deposits by business defined by Basel III LCR guidelines partnering with business treasurers. The model estimates the liquidity value of the firm deposits. CFO reviews the report with senior management in the monthly balance sheet review meeting and quarterly global town hall to manage the businesses encourage lower run-off deposits in lieu of higher run-off deposits.Asset Liability Management and Liquidity Stress Testing - Implemented Asset Liability management model including Market Access Reporting (MAR), the short term liquidity matrix Maximum Cash Outflow reporting (MCO), Liquidity Stress Testing Simulation and Forecasting for the Broker-Dealer and Bank business and Parent Company globally across all regions. Worked with bank and broker dealer liquidity risk managers, risk oversight and treasury senior management across the globe (US, UK, HK, Singapore and Japan) as part of various engagements.Financial Products Template - Assisted developing Product Templates for regulatory reporting by reviewing Fed Instructions: Securities, Secured Financing, Loans, Derivatives, Inter-company template and related data enrichments with Securities Master Central (SMC) and Account Master Central (AMC).FRB Counter-party funding, MRA, MRIA -  Rolled out the Fed requirement of FRB Weekly Counter-party funding to assess the top 10 counter-party risk. Implementation of Mandatory Regulatory Action (MRA) for Daily Deposits reporting and MCO reporting.Daily 4G- Built an End User Computing model to produce the inter-company lines for the major legal entities - Parent Company, CBNA, Broker-Dealer and Banamex to fulfilled the daily 4G inter-company reporting requirement for the key legal entities.", ' Analyzed financial statements for profit & loss, cash flows, forecast and variance. column9: ["Performed dispositions, acquisitions, financing and asset management for the nation's largest apartment investor.* Dispositions: Executed the sale of 17 LIHTC properties with 2,700 units for $98 million in gross pricing at a blended5.2% in-place cap rate.  Hired brokers, sourced direct buyers and negotiated contract terms.o Sold a Ferguson, MO property despite low occupancy of 73% and frequent crime onsite.  Secured a salesprice at a 1.5% cap rate that was 6x higher than the average of three BOV's, by offering a rich commission to incentivize brokers.  Negotiated 33% of the contract price, well above market norms, to be depositednon-refundable with escrow prior to closing, to minimize the risk of the buyer's poor credit profile.o Sold a Port Arthur, TX property after it sustained $1 million in flood damage from Hurricane Harvey, with no flood insurance, leaving the property vacant with 100% of the units down.  Secured a sales price at thepar amount of the debt, provided the buyer assumed the existing loan and funded all restoration costs, which eliminated Alden's funding exposure.* Acquisitions: Led firm-wide initiative to acquire Class B/C conventional and LIHTC properties in CA, FL, AZ, GAand TX.  Theorized and underwrote opportunities while arranging new debt through mortgage bankers.  Receivedinvestment committee approval to formally bid on seven separate properties with 1,450 units at offer pricing of$85 million, though Alden was not awarded any of these deals due to competitive market conditions.* Financing: Co-led a large refinance initiative through Greystone using HUD's FHA 223(f) loan program.  Refinancedexisting debt on 16 properties with 2,900 units, totaling $150 million in new loan proceeds, representing 5% of HUD's annual affordable housing volume.* Asset Management: Led firm-wide initiative to analyze sell-versus-hold scenarios on Alden's watch-list portfolio.Performed physical inspections of 51 properties with 10,200 units, recommending to committee to sell 24 and hold 27, with reposition strategies such as refinancing debt, changing property management firms, pushing rents and reducing expenses.", "Founded the firm's asset management platform, leading a team that included an associate, an analyst and two independentasset managers.  Served as shareholder, fund investor and member of the management team, reporting to the COO.Responsible for managing JCR's entire portfolio, consisting of 77 active transactions with AUM of $550 million across threeequity funds and two debt platforms.  Investment types included preferred equity, JV equity, senior debt and mezzanine debt.Asset types included opportunistic value-add multifamily, industrial, retail, office and land in 25 states.Led the execution of business plans on all JCR transactions, culminating in successful exits.  Led all disposition, workout,portfolio monitoring, capex draw administration, investor reporting and fair-market valuation activities.  Controlledcommunication and information flow between general partners, JCR senior management and fund investors.  Presentedplatform performance during road-shows that helped to attract two new GP investors and raise $330 million from LP's for Fund III.  Oversaw significant portfolio expansion from 22 active transactions in 2012 to 77 in 2016.  Recruited, hired andtrained an associate and two analysts.  Authored a 51-page policy manual.* Promoted from Vice President to Director in 2015.* Harvested $187 million in realization dollars, with no principal loss, consisting of:o $99 million across equity funds through the full disposition of 40 transactions and partial realizations of 16, which includes the disposition of seven multifamily properties with 1,500 units.o $88 million across debt platforms through full payoffs of 14 loans and partial realizations of 35.* Negotiated and executed the following workout strategies:o Sale to the GP of JCR's LP interest in a Prescott, AZ residential land asset that removed 18-24 months of carry risk in a volatile home-building market.o 12-month forbearance agreement for a defaulted loan on a Houston apartment, exited successfully via sale.o Structured multiple short-term extensions for a defaulted loan on a Williston, ND apartment property, with significant principal risk from the softening housing market due to declining oil prices.  Exited successfullyvia CMBS refinance with equity-like returns on a senior loan due to extension fees.", "Underwrote 17 commercial real estate credit relationships totaling $384 million in loan exposure, secured by multifamily,office, retail and industrial properties.  Named one of two Team Leads, with indirect supervision of four analysts, reviewingcredit memos prior to distribution through the approval hierarchy.* Promoted from Underwriter to Senior Underwriter in 2012.* Executed new $30 million senior loan on a Colorado Springs, CO apartment property, one of the bank's largestindividual real estate transactions of 2012.", "Underwrote and asset-managed senior healthcare properties, including skilled nursing, assisted living and independent living.Assisted in drafting SEC registration forms and road-show marketing materials for the firm's IPO on the NYSE.* Promoted from Analyst to Director in 2010.* Executed the acquisition and sale-leaseback of 22 properties with 2,300 beds for $141 million, gaining investmentcommittee approval, drafting LOIs, negotiating terms and coordinating third-parties.o Executed an 8-property portfolio acquisition in CA, OR and WA for $69 million, the largest in firm history.o Originated a 3-property portfolio acquisition in Arkansas for $9 million.* Asset-managed 92 properties in 21 states valued at $496 million, approximately half of the firm's AUM.  Identifiedwatch-list properties by using coverage ratios and physical plant conditions, making recommendations to seniormanagement to either sell or hold and invest additional capital.  Managed capex draws and quarterly financialreporting to syndicated credit group.", 'Relationship-managed a $78 million construction loan portfolio comprised of nine borrowers. column9: ['I was responsible for representing our clients in their corporate real estate transactions throughout North America. Specific tasks included preparing market studies and surveys, conducting market tours, and consulting on site selection and lease negotiations. My primary client was WESCO (Westinghouse Electric Supply Co.), as I was in charge of representing all branches in Western Canada (Provinces of Saskatchewan, Alberta, and British Columbia). I also represented them in select US market transactions from Bala Cynwyd, PA to Portland, OR. Other clients exclusively represented by Fischer throughout North America that I consulted with were: ALCOA, Fed Ex Freight, Fed Ex Ground, Fed Ex Trade Networks, Service Master, and ANH Refractories. Additional duties included business development activities targeting local Pittsburgh companies, large corporations with multiple locations, and training clients on the use of our proprietary project and portfolio management software. I was also responsible for construction management oversight of many of my clients build outs. During my tenure at Fischer I led the Pittsburgh office in; business development opportunities with national multi-market corporations, and average value add per lease transaction on the WESCO account.CB Richard Ellis - Pittsburgh, PA - 14 Years - Senior Director - Corporate Services Group. I was solely responsible for the business development activities of our team. I researched and prospected for, made presentations and secured clients. I would then integrate the appropriate project team based upon the client\'s needs and complexity of the transaction. I monitored the progress of each project from kick off to completion. I usually took the lead on the larger and more complicated transactions. My client\'s lease renewals or relocations would regularly appear in the Pittsburgh Business Times annual Book of Lists, as the 25 Largest Leases of the year were featured. Other responsibilities included ensuring the market research database was up to date, and working with the marketing group to produce market studies, market reports, individual building data sheets, and presentation materials. I was also responsible for construction management oversight of many of my clients build outs.CB Richard Ellis - Pittsburgh Market ReportI headed up the team as we published our first office market report. We surveyed and cataloged over 55 Million square feet of office space in Pittsburgh\'s CBD (Central Business District) and suburban markets. After the market survey was completed I wrote the market analysis that accompanied the office market statistics. Individual Building Data Sheets were produced from the survey results. This took approximately two months to complete.  Publishing a market report was a requirement of CB Richard Ellis in their purchase of our real estate firm. The information gained during this process was invaluable as my knowledge of the Pittsburgh office market took a quantum leap forward.Drift of the Day Blog Site - For the past two years I have published a blog site dedicated to the Chautauqua Amphitheater rebuild debate. Advocating for a new "Amp" and in support of Chautauqua\'s administration and board I published monthly posts on a variety of topics building a case for the new "Amp". I also rebutted numerous, false and misleading statements made by the "Save the Amp Committee" in their emails, and on their web site to accurately inform the Chautauqua community.  In the twenty-two months since it has been active the site has received over 14,500 hits. I\'ve used the Mail Chimp mass emailing program to notify my 1,600+ subscribers of new posts on the site. Below is a link to my first post for your review.https://driftoftheday.wordpress.com/chautauquas-amphitheater-redux-v-3-0/', 'I was responsible for advertising sales in this business to business publication. I serviced existing accounts and led all account executives in sales and developing new business. I also consulted with clients who were not represented by an advertising agency on ad size, placement, copywriting and graphic design. During this time I led all account executives in advertising sales.Time Warner Cable - Jamestown, NY - 2 years - Media Consultant.  I was responsible for advertising sales on the cable networks to existing clients and developing new business. I consulted with clients on advertising scheduling, placement, and copywriting. I also assisted the production department in the editing of spots, performing some voice over work and on the development of local programming. During this time I led all media consultants in advertising sales.']

Other clients exclusively represented by Fischer throughout North America that I consulted with were: ALCOA, Fed Ex Freight, Fed Ex Ground, Fed Ex Trade Networks, Service Master, and ANH Refractories. Additional duties included business development activities targeting local Pittsburgh companies, large corporations with multiple locations, and training clients on the use of our proprietary project and portfolio management software. I was also responsible for construction management oversight of many of my clients build outs. During my tenure at Fischer I led the Pittsburgh office in; business development opportunities with national multi-market corporations, and average value add per lease transaction on the WESCO account.CB Richard Ellis - Pittsburgh, PA - 14 Years - Senior Director - Corporate Services Group. I was solely responsible for the business development activities of our team. I researched and prospected for, made presentations and secured clients. I would then integrate the appropriate project team based upon the client\'s needs and complexity of the transaction. I monitored the progress of each project from kick off to completion. I usually took the lead on the larger and more complicated transactions. My client\'s lease renewals or relocations would regularly appear in the Pittsburgh Business Times annual Book of Lists, as the 25 Largest Leases of the year were featured. Other responsibilities included ensuring the market research database was up to date, and working with the marketing group to produce market studies, market reports, individual building data sheets, and presentation materials. I was also responsible for construction management oversight of many of my clients build outs.CB Richard Ellis - Pittsburgh Market ReportI headed up the team as we published our first office market report. We surveyed and cataloged over 55 Million square feet of office space in Pittsburgh\'s CBD (Central Business District) and suburban markets. After the market survey was completed I wrote the market analysis that accompanied the office market statistics. Individual Building Data Sheets were produced from the survey results. This took approximately two months to complete.  Publishing a market report was a requirement of CB Richard Ellis in their purchase of our real estate firm. The information gained during this process was invaluable as my knowledge of the Pittsburgh office market took a quantum leap forward.Drift of the Day Blog Site - For the past two years I have published a blog site dedicated to the Chautauqua Amphitheater rebuild debate. Advocating for a new "Amp" and in support of Chautauqua\'s administration and board I published monthly posts on a variety of topics building a case for the new "Amp". I also rebutted numerous, false and misleading statements made by the "Save the Amp Committee" in their emails, and on their web site to accurately inform the Chautauqua community.  In the twenty-two months since it has been active the site has received over 14,500 hits. I\'ve used the Mail Chimp mass emailing program to notify my 1,600+ subscribers of new posts on the site. Below is a link to my first post for your review.https://driftoftheday.wordpress.com/chautauquas-amphitheater-redux-v-3-0/', 'I was responsible for advertising sales in this business to business publication. I serviced existing accounts and led all account executives in sales and developing new business. I also consulted with clients who were not represented by an advertising agency on ad size, placement, copywriting and graphic design. During this time I led all account executives in advertising sales.Time Warner Cable - Jamestown, NY - 2 years - Media Consultant.  I was responsible for advertising sales on the cable networks to existing clients and developing new business. I consulted with clients on advertising scheduling, placement, and copywriting. I also assisted the production department in the editing of spots, performing some voice over work and on the development of local programming. During this time I led all media consultants in advertising sales.']

column9: ["As a Vice President within the firm, I serve as the Architect of Record for the firm's design practice. I am responsible for carrying these projects from initial on-site conditions assessment, through design  and preparation of permit documents, to performing construction administration tasks. presented at 10+ conferences in 8 years.o    Increased revenue by training the sales and marketing teams on product specifics, enabling the company to clearly define market positioning, product branding, and the commercialization strategy.', 'Promoted to manage multiple simultaneous field research projects, including establishing project plans, communications, timelines, and budgets across multiple internal and external stakeholder groups.o    Led the companyÈs effort to expand proof of concept studies from laboratory animals to wild animals in both captive and field settings; managed multiple concurrent projects for product development in each setting.o    Achieved operations consistency by establishing new research protocols, animal use protocols, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for data collection, project schedules, and budgets.o    Drove the end-to-end field research process with ownership for data collection, project databases, data analysis, and reporting;
